text:
Desimartini Vishwaroopam 2 to finally release, Kamal Haasan says still six months to go 
Kamal Haasan has tweeted to say that the much-delayed Vishwaroopam 2 will release soon and the only things holding it back are a few technical and legal issues. regional movies Updated: Feb 17, 2017 13:21 IST Hindustan Times, New Delhi Kamal Haasan’s Vishwaroopam was a Tamil spy thriller which released in 2013. 
Vishwaroopam 2, the sequel to Kamal Haasan’s 2013’s Tamil spy thriller Vishwaroopam, is finally set for a release, the actor tweeted on Friday. Read more Actor Kamal Haasan says people must be incorruptible amid TN’s political crisis 
Kamal assured fans that he is personally involved to ensure that the film is cleared. But he asked all to wait for another six months as some technical and legal issues remain. 4 all looking forward to VR2. Am personally getting in 2 clear the path. Bigger obstacles are out of the way. Whats left istechnical & legal — Kamal Haasan (@ikamalhaasan) February 17, 2017 But bear with my team and me. Post will take 6months pic.twitter.com/9nfF4bBdbj — Kamal Haasan (@ikamalhaasan) February 17, 2017 
The film stars Kamal Haasan, Pooja Kumar, Andrea, Shekhar Kapur and Rahul Bose and is set in India, unlike the previous one which was based in the United States. Vishwaroopam 2, which has been written, directed and co-produced by Haasan, will release simultaneously in Tamil, Hindi and Telugu, reports Times of India. While the film’s music is by Ghibran, the cinematography has been done by Shamdat Sainuddeen.
